means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 金斯曼来源于中世纪英语，含义是“亲属+人”(kin+man)

sentence.Network_en: Kinsman helps kinsman, but woe to him that hath nothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 亲人帮亲人, 无亲愁煞人.

sentence.Network_en: Tracing back our genealogies , I found he was a kinsman of mine.
sentence.Network_cn: 转弯抹角算起来 —— 他算是我的一个亲戚.

sentence.Network_en: A near friend is better than a far dwelling kinsman.

list.exp: 路得记中的至亲救赎者
list.abs: 路得记中的至亲救赎者 (Kinsman Redeemer)　　撒母耳记中大卫的后裔 　　列王记中的以色列真正的王 　　历代志中先祖的神 　　以斯拉记中.
health is the best gain ; contentment is the best wealth . a trusty friend is the best kinsman ; Nirvana ( liberation ) is the supreme bliss .健康是最佳的利益；满足是最好的财富。守信的朋友是最好的亲戚；没有烦恼是最大的幸福。

entry.def: Someone's kinsman is their male relative.

auth_sentence.content: Calling himself "Woeful," Siegmund tells of a disaster-filled life, only to learn that Hunding is a kinsman of his enemies.
auth_sentence.res_content: Calling himself "Woeful," Siegmund tells of a disaster-filled life, only to learn that Hunding is a kinsman of his enemies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Calling himself "Woeful," Siegmund tells of a disaster-filled life, only to learn that Hunding is a kinsman of his enemies.

auth_sentence.content: Her kinsman Lord Mowbray and Stourton objected at the time to what he called "experiments" on her remains.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her kinsman Lord Mowbray and Stourton objected at the time to what he called "experiments" on her remains.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her kinsman Lord Mowbray and Stourton objected at the time to what he called "experiments" on her remains.

auth_sentence.content: His health was weak, and a kinsman, Father Charlet, who was the rector of the school, managed to secure him special treatment.

sentences.en: A near friend is better than a far-dwelling kinsman.
